website_summaries.verdict: One of the better cube case options for anyone needing an affordable and large computer case.
pros: Data storage racks include space for up to four hard drives for extra storage
Side vents include filters for better dust control
cons: Dust filters do not work as well as third party options
Side panels are prone to bending

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic case! Good airflow and so much room for ...
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic case! Good airflow and so much room for a compact case. Its pretty much exactly like the Thermaltake Core V1. Also able to fit a GTX 970 SSC and can probably fit a card 1 inch longer. Case also has magnetic dust filters unlike the Core V1. Overall awesome case for a mini itx build. SPECS: Intel i5 4690k 8GB Crucial Ballistix Sport EVGA GTX 970 SSC Gigabyte LGA 1150 B85 ARCTIC Freezer 13 Limited Edition CPU Cooler EVGA SuperNOVA 750 B1 Thermaltake Suppressor F1 Case 256GB Mushkin MSATA SSD 3TB Seagate Desktop HD
customer_reviews.author: Francis

customer_reviews.title: A great case that doesn't scream "LOOK AT MY GAMING RIG"
customer_reviews.text: A handsome and stately case for older people like myself who don't care for a light-bright/led zeppelin laser show coming out of their case, although there is a window on top if you want a little of that. The detachable dust screens are neat, as is the giant quiet fan. All my components went in without too much trouble. I docked a star because one of the included wires built into the case for the HDD light slipped right out of the plug harness, and I never got around to fixing it. Who needs that blicking light anyway?
customer_reviews.author: Schneid

customer_reviews.title: Extremely space saving case .
customer_reviews.text: Its a very fun case to build in . Only down side , the space from the motherboard level to the top of the case is limited for aftermarket cpu cooling . Could not fit my CoolMaster 212 cpu cooler . Computer Specs : Ryzen5 2400g (Oc) to 3.8ghz at 1.45 volts MSI B450i Mb Gaming Plus AC Corsair 16gb 3000ghz ram running at 3066 240gb PNY (SSD) 700watt psu by Thermaltake . Only thing that I dont like is the thumb screws for the case wish they would of added normal tower screws to give you atleast an option . But I went and bought some on Amazon for cheap .
customer_reviews.author: Roly Harter

customer_reviews.title: A true successor to the Thermaltake Core V1 Cube
customer_reviews.text: It's the same chassis as the Core V1 Cube mini-ITX, but it is quieter and looks better. I own both and can confirm that the way this case is vented is also much better for keeping dust out. Easy to build on and manage cables. Fits most video cards, most likely wont fit the 3 fan models or the older blower style cards. Works very well for non-overclocked air cooled systems. Will require some thought for overclocked systems as liquid cooling will become a requirement in this case and you will be limited by the size of radiators you can squeeze into this case.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan M.

customer_reviews.title: Love the Cube!
customer_reviews.text: Great form factor! While it’s not the smallest that is perfectly fine to me, it’s the size of a basketball but in cube form! It keeps everything just as cool as my old tower, just make sure to buy 2 80mm fans for the exhaust and a fan splitter just Incase your motherboard only has 2 case fan headers because the 200mm fan that comes in this case will need one! Does not take up a lot of room while still providing great airflow 😎 great price too! Easiest case I have worked in because every panel comes off! Top,bottom and sides!
customer_reviews.author: angela

customer_reviews.title: Great Case, fragile F-Panel connections.
customer_reviews.text: It seems to be a common issue that people have to call thermaltake to replace the front panel with the power button and usb cables. I ignored it because I am incredibly careful with my computers, and maybe some of it has to do with how poorly amazon ships packages now, but after a week of having my computer built, my F-Panel connections died and now I can only see my hdd led and my reset button does not function. It's really disappointing because I am now passed my exchange date and have to either contact thermaltake myself or just buy a more durable case.
customer_reviews.author: Levi

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my new VR Ready Rig!
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't ask anything more out of a case. Unless you are building a rig with multiple video cards, this thing has all the room you need. Especially appreciate the magnetic mesh covers for the intakes, and the enormous intake fan behind the front faceplate is SILENT.
customer_reviews.author: Vantage9

customer_reviews.title: Nice Mini-ITX Cube Case
customer_reviews.text: Nice case. I like how the top window panel can be switched to a side window panel on either side! I kept it on top, but I like the option. It is quite spacious, which also means it kinda big (for a mini-itx board). What I do not like is the cooling design. It comes with a big 200m fan upfront, but the front panel suffocates it. And I wish it was designed to use a 120mm/140mm fan for the rear instead of two 80mm. The side panels may be good for ventilation but also expect it to get very dusty.
customer_reviews.author: TJinJin

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected and quiet
customer_reviews.text: This is a well thought out case and being able to take all sides off was sooo nice!. It made the build so much easier. Honestly the thing that took the most time was cable management. This case has ample space for cables and provides zip ties but I use velcro ties for most stuff. I thought the 200mm fan would be would be noisy but its utterly quiet. I would recommend this case to anyone. Good quality Excellent price.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Moore

customer_reviews.title: Looks great, ideal case for itx setup. Careful with the expansions slots.
customer_reviews.text: I really like how it looks, fit perfectly a full size power supply, with a ryzen cooler inside. Be careful! it's only have 2 extension bays, so I needed to buy another video card. Materials are really thin an fragile, the 20cm cooler isn't loud. I really love it.
customer_reviews.author: Pablo Manzoni

customer_reviews.title: bery good for mini itx build
customer_reviews.text: did a build with this case and it was seamless very easy to negotiate just enough room to put my build together without having to fight the space.very light after the build. would highly suggest a modular power supply so that you wont muck up cable management with cables you arent using the hd mounts were a little clunky but not overbearingly difficult to work with. one of the best builds i have done.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality control
customer_reviews.text: Was happy to receive this case but when I opened it I discovered that the front panel is damaged. Front panel was scratched and had blemishes. Poor quality control on Thermaltake's part. First time I ordered something from Thermaltake.
customer_reviews.author: Boris G

customer_reviews.title: Easy to work in
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Easy to work in, although you do need to plan out the build a bit. The hard drive enclosure wants you to connect the power and SATA to the drives on the top side, but it takes a bit more work to invert it. lots of space for cable management and fits a full length GTX 1070 easily. Cooling is impressive and my system runs rather cool in it. Overall, for it's price, this case is a brilliant little mini-ITX case. Buy with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Dawoud

customer_reviews.title: Okay case
customer_reviews.text: This was the first build Ive done in years so I did a fair amount of research before I purchased this. I really like the size and shape of this case. Plenty of room for installing components. I would give this more stars, however one of the bottom feet fell off a day after I got it.. other than that it seems like a pretty sturdy case.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathon

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorite builds so far
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this pc case so far, it's compact, it's quiet and if you can cable manage perfectly, even as a starter case, it's perfect as well! I highly recommend to anyone looking to build an itx PC
customer_reviews.author: Robert davenport

customer_reviews.title: Awesome case, fits a full size card, Titan X FE
customer_reviews.text: Small, compact and can move around if you need to, for example, to play VR in family room hooked up to 4k TV. A plus that it can fit a full size Nvidia FE card, also can fit a corsair AIO water cooler, 120mm. Great little ITX build.
customer_reviews.author: JHN

customer_reviews.title: Best ITX Case
customer_reviews.text: Best Mini ITX case without compromising on cable management or video card size. Was able to fit a EVGA SSC 1060 with a little room to spare. Finding a good aircooler to fit is a little tricky as max height is 140mm, I used the Cryorig M9i.
customer_reviews.author: Niv

customer_reviews.title: Tiny little case with just enough room for some serious power
customer_reviews.text: This case is whats holding my i7 7700, GTX 960 and a aftermarket cooler. It allows for 2 solid state drives and 2 full size hard drives. the only thing you need to keep an eye on is the graphics card size, Mine barely can fit.
customer_reviews.author: Darrik

customer_reviews.title: Love it, just perfect
customer_reviews.text: Love the case, perfect size for Mini ITX, space to work with, not too cramped, and super small, fits in the corner of my desk behind my monitor, only thing that could be better is if they were stackable so I could buy another and stack them up.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb

customer_reviews.title: Nice little case but...
customer_reviews.text: An optical drive bay would have been nice. Only bad thing i have to say about it.
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: Awesome value
customer_reviews.text: A very good case for not very much money. The layout and the fact you can take off all the panels made it very easy to build in.
customer_reviews.author: pro internet reviewer

customer_reviews.title: A+ case
customer_reviews.text: It is the perfect size to accommodate graphics cards of all sizes, run cooling, and fit some storage beyond your OS drive.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice small pacakage
customer_reviews.text: Really nice incognito HTPC. 200mm fan that’s included is efficient and quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Edward Rivera

customer_reviews.title: Check condition carefully
customer_reviews.text: Excellent case, however mine arrived with scratched acrylic in the top window.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch hackett

customer_reviews.title: It looks good, it's not too loud
customer_reviews.text: This is a really solid case for an ITX pc. It looks good, it's not too loud, and it's small enough to have on my desk.
customer_reviews.author: J. Bednarz

customer_reviews.title: The case is easy to work with
customer_reviews.text: The case is easy to work with, even for a person new to building pcs. The only criticism I have so far is that the magnets on the filters were not glued on properly.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: super easy to build in, supports full size cards (reference 980ti), good airflow with a quiet fan.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron F.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent little case
customer_reviews.text: Excellent little case. All the sides come off making it easy to work with. The sleek look fits well into a computer room or home entertainment system.
customer_reviews.author: F1 Systems

product_meta.title: Thermaltake Suppressor F1 Mini ITX Tt LCS Certified Cube Computer Chassis CA-1E6-00S1WN-00, Black
product_meta.description:
Style:F1Thermaltake Suppressor F1 Mini ITX Cube Chassis Tt LCS Certified Gaming Computer Case CA-1E6-00S1WN-00

The Suppressor F1 Mini ITX Cube Chassis is the latest series to the Thermaltake case line. Designed for Mini ITX motherboard solutions, save space and gain more with multiple configurations for both Air and Liquid cooling setups, the Suppressor F1 offers a balance of compact design and cooling performance. Extend your GPU performance with chassis pass-through VGA support up to 285mm and PSU lengths up to 200mm. Maintain cable management with allotted spacing for optimized air flow and stay cool with built-in 200mm front fan for a mini cube case that fits perfectly even when space is limited.

Key Features: 

 * Case Type: Mid Tower Chassis
 * Case Dimension (H x W x D): 10.9" x 10.2" x 12.6"
 * M/B Support: Mini-ITX (6.7" x 6.7")
 * Supports Standard PS2 Power Supply
 * Pre-installed Black 200mm Fans included (Front)
 * Internal Bay: 2x 3.5"/2.5"
 * Expansion Slots: 2
 * Front I/O Panel: 2x USB 3.0, 1x Headphone, 1x Mic Port

Fan Configurations: (Optional)

Front: 
1 x 120mm or 1 x 140mm or 1 x 200mm
Rear: 
2 x 80mm

Radiator Configurations: (Optional)

Front: 
1 x 120mm or 1 x 140mm

Clearance:  * CPU Cooler Height: 140mm
 * VGA Length:255mm (Standard), 285mm (Extended)
 * PSU Length: 200mm

Support 

Please visit our website or search "Thermaltake Support" for any assistance.
feature_bullets: Great Expansion: Install up to 4 data storage devices w/the modular drive racks, a dual expansion slot VGA up to 255mm, a tower CPU cooler up to 140mm, together with a high wattage PSU up to180mm, and still offers a 80mm cable management space

Interchangeable Side Panels: Symmetrical panels allow users to build the system with personality. 2 magnetic and removable side filters and 1 removable PUS dust filter and 1 adjustable shockproof rubbers built with bottom pane
Outstanding Cooling Performance: Dual modular 2.5" / 3.5" Drive Bays. ATX PSU and DIY liquid cooling system Supported
Minimalist I/P Ports Design: 2x USB 3.0, 1x Headphone, 1x Mic Top Ports

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars77 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
